segments.text: I see the woman standing in the puddle, completely unaware of the water around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how oblivious she is to everything happening in her kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, and she’s drying a plate like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t felt the water on her foot yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are right behind her, taking cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s always this unaware or if today is just an off day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is going to be ruined, and she’s just going to keep polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to be in for a big surprise when she finally looks around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so absurd, it’s almost like a comedy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I’m also worried about the mess she’s going to have to clean up.
segments.speaker: PAR
